about_page.title: Our
about_page.subtitle: Empowering everyone to understand and navigate the digital financial revolution.
about_page.why_exist_p1: The world of cryptocurrencies, blockchain, and CBDCs can be overwhelming. Complex jargon, conflicting information, and predatory "gurus" make it hard for newcomers to learn safely.
about_page.why_exist_p2_strong: Memento Academy was created to change that.
about_page.why_exist_p2: We believe that understanding digital finance shouldn't require a computer science degree or expensive courses.

free.title: 100% Free Education
free.desc: All our courses, guides, and resources are completely free. No hidden fees, no premium tiers, no paywalls.

beginner.title: Beginner-First Approach
beginner.desc: We explain everything assuming zero prior knowledge. No jargon, no gatekeeping.

noscam.title: No Shilling, No Scams
noscam.desc: We never promote specific cryptocurrencies or investment advice. Our goal is education, not sales.

global.title: Global & Accessible
global.desc: Knowledge should have no borders. We're working to make our content available in multiple languages.

about_page.help_desc: Memento Academy is a community project. We welcome contributions in many forms: writing guides, translating content, helping newcomers in our Discord, or spreading the word.
about_page.cta_desc: Join our community and begin learning for free.

knowledge_base_page.title: Knowledge
knowledge_base_page.subtitle: Find quick answers to the most common questions about Web3, crypto, and digital finance.

web3.title: Web3 & Blockchain
web3.q1: What's the difference between Web2 and Web3?
web3.a1: Web2 is the current internet where platforms own your data (Facebook, Google). Web3 is the decentralized internet where you own your data, identity, and assets through blockchain technology.
web3.q2: Do I need to be technical to understand Web3?
web3.a2: Not at all! Our courses are designed for absolute beginners. We explain everything in simple terms without requiring any technical background.
web3.q3: Is blockchain the same as cryptocurrency?
web3.a3: No. Blockchain is the technology (a decentralized ledger), while cryptocurrency is one application of that technology (digital money). Blockchain can be used for many things beyond currencies.

crypto.title: Cryptocurrencies
crypto.a1: In most countries, yes. However, regulations vary. Some countries have banned it, while others have embraced it. Always check your local laws.
crypto.q2: How do I buy my first cryptocurrency?
crypto.a2: You can use exchanges like Coinbase or Binance. Create an account, verify your identity, and purchase with bank transfer or card. Start with small amounts while learning.
crypto.q3: What's a wallet and do I need one?
crypto.a3: A wallet stores your cryptocurrency. For beginners, exchange wallets are fine. As you learn more, you may want a personal wallet like MetaMask (hot) or Ledger (cold) for better security.

cbdc.title: CBDCs
cbdc.q1: When will the Digital Euro launch?
cbdc.a1: The European Central Bank is targeting 2027-2028 for a potential launch. It's currently in the 'preparation phase' after completing the investigation phase in 2023.
cbdc.a2: Central banks claim CBDCs will complement cash, not replace it. However, many privacy advocates are concerned this could eventually lead to a cashless society.
cbdc.a3: No. CBDCs are centrally controlled by governments, while Bitcoin is decentralized with no central authority. CBDCs can be censored and monitored; Bitcoin transactions are pseudonymous.

security.title: Security
security.q1: How do I spot a crypto scam?
security.a1: Red flags: promises of guaranteed returns, pressure to act fast, requests for your seed phrase, unsolicited offers, and projects with anonymous teams. If it sounds too good to be true, it is.
security.q2: What should I do if I've been scammed?
security.a2: Unfortunately, blockchain transactions are irreversible. Document everything, report to authorities and the platform involved, and warn others to prevent more victims.
security.q3: Is it safe to keep crypto on an exchange?
security.a3: For beginners with small amounts, it's convenient. But 'not your keys, not your crypto' - for larger amounts, use a personal wallet where you control the private keys.

privacy_page.title: Privacy Policy
privacy_page.intro: At Memento Academy, we take your privacy seriously. This policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your personal information.

section1.title: 1. Information We Collect
section1.text1: We collect information you provide directly:

list1.email_desc: when you subscribe to our newsletter
list1.name: Name
list1.name_desc: optionally, when provided with your subscription

list2.analytics: Basic analytics data (pages visited, time on site)

section2.title: 2. How We Use Your Information

list.item1: Send you our newsletter and updates you've subscribed to
list.item2: Improve our content and user experience
list.item3: Respond to your questions and requests

section2.text2_suffix: to third parties. We never share your email with advertisers.

section3.title: 3. Email Communications
section3.text: If you subscribe to our newsletter, you'll receive educational content based on your preferences. Every email includes an unsubscribe link. We use Brevo (formerly Sendinblue) to send emails.

section4.title: 4. Cookies & Tracking
section4.text: We use minimal, privacy-respecting analytics. We do not use advertising cookies or cross-site tracking. Essential cookies may be used for authentication and site functionality.

section5.title: 5. Data Security
section5.text: We implement appropriate security measures to protect your information. Our database is hosted on Supabase with encryption at rest. However, no internet transmission is 100% secure.

section6.title: 6. Your Rights

list.item4: Unsubscribe from communications at any time

section6.text2: To exercise these rights, contact us at

section7.title: 7. Third-Party Services
section7.text: We use the following third-party services:

section8.title: 8. Children's Privacy
section8.text: Our service is not directed to children under 13. We do not knowingly collect information from children under 13.

section9.title: 9. Changes to This Policy
section9.text: We may update this policy from time to time. We'll notify you of significant changes via email or a notice on our website.

section10.title: 10. Contact Us
section10.text: Questions about this policy? Contact us at

terms_page.title: Terms of Service
terms_page.intro: By using Memento Academy, you agree to these terms. Please read them carefully.

section1.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
section1.text: By accessing or using Memento Academy ("the Service"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you disagree with any part, you may not access the Service.

section2.title: 2. Description of Service
section2.text: Memento Academy is a free educational platform providing content about Web3, blockchain, cryptocurrencies, and related topics. Our content is for educational purposes only.

section3.title: 3. Educational Content Disclaimer
section3.warning_text: Our content is educational only. We do NOT provide financial, investment, legal, or tax advice. Cryptocurrency investments carry significant risk. Always do your own research and consult professionals before making financial decisions.

list.item2: Use the Service for lawful purposes only
list.item3: Not attempt to harm or disrupt the Service
list.item4: Not copy, modify, or redistribute our content without permission
list.item5: Not use the Service to spam or harass others

section5.title: 5. Intellectual Property
section5.text1: All content on Memento Academy (text, graphics, logos, images) is our property or licensed to us. You may share our content for personal, non-commercial purposes with proper attribution.
section5.text2: Our educational materials are freely available, but may not be sold or used in commercial products without written permission.

section6.title: 6. User-Generated Content
section6.text: If you submit content (comments, forum posts, etc.), you grant us a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use, display, and distribute that content. You remain responsible for your submissions.

section7.title: 7. Third-Party Links
section7.text: Our Service may contain links to external websites. We are not responsible for their content or practices. Access third-party sites at your own risk.

section8.title: 8. Limitation of Liability
section8.text: Memento Academy is provided "as is" without warranties of any kind. We are not liable for any damages arising from your use of the Service, including but not limited to financial losses from cryptocurrency investments.

section9.title: 9. Modifications to Service
section9.text: We reserve the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue any part of the Service at any time without notice. We may also update these Terms periodically.

section10.title: 10. Termination
section10.text: We may terminate or suspend your access to the Service immediately, without prior notice, for conduct that we believe violates these Terms or is harmful to other users.

section11.title: 11. Governing Law
section11.text: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with applicable laws, without regard to conflict of law provisions.

section12.title: 12. Contact Information
section12.text: For questions about these Terms, contact us at

terms_page.outro: By using Memento Academy, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service.

cookie_page.title: Cookie Policy
cookie_page.intro: This Cookie Policy explains what cookies are, how we use them, and your choices regarding their use.

section1.title: 1. What Are Cookies?
section1.text: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device (computer, tablet, or mobile) when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and to provide information to site owners.

section2.title: 2. How We Use Cookies
section2.text: We use cookies for the following purposes:

list.item1: Essential cookies: Necessary for the website to function properly (authentication, security)
list.item2: Analytics cookies: Help us understand how visitors use our site (Google Analytics)
list.item3: Preference cookies: Remember your settings and preferences

section3.title: 3. Cookies We Use
section3.essential_desc: These cookies are strictly necessary for the website to function. They cannot be disabled.
section3.analytics_desc: These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website. All data is anonymized.

section4.title: 4. Third-Party Cookies
section4.text: Some cookies are placed by third-party services that appear on our pages:

google_analytics.name: Google Analytics
google_analytics.desc: We use Google Analytics to analyze website usage. Google may transfer data to servers in the United States.

section5.title: 5. Managing Your Cookie Preferences
section5.text1: You can manage your cookie preferences at any time by clicking the "Manage cookies" button in the footer of our website.
section5.text2: You can also control cookies through your browser settings. Note that disabling certain cookies may affect website functionality.
section5.browser_links: Learn how to manage cookies in your browser:

section6.title: 6. Changes to This Policy
section6.text: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new policy on this page.

section7.title: 7. Contact Us
section7.text: If you have questions about our use of cookies, contact us at
